message.content:
cs.MA, cs.GT, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.SY 

This paper deals with the problem of multi-agent coordination, which is a core topic in the field of multi-agent systems (MAS). The paper proposes a framework for coordination based on a convention of courtesy, which is a social norm that humans often follow to achieve efficient and fair outcomes. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the cs.MA (multi-agent systems) sub-category. 

The paper also discusses the concept of equilibrium in repeated allocation games, which is a topic in game theory (cs.GT). The paper proposes a strategy that constitutes an $\epsilon$-subgame-perfect equilibrium, which further supports the likelihood of cs.GT as a sub-category. 

The paper proposes a framework that uses machine learning techniques to achieve coordination, which suggests that it could belong to the cs.AI (artificial intelligence) sub-category. 

The paper also discusses the efficiency and fairness of the proposed framework, which are topics in the sub-categories of cs.LG (machine learning) and cs.SY (systems and control). 

Overall, the most likely sub-categories for this paper are cs.MA, cs.GT, cs.AI, cs.LG, and cs.SY, in that order.
